properties.name: Bartini
properties.description: Posted by Realjeremytaste  2108 NW Glisan St, Portland, OROne of those bars that has trendy foods and trendy drinks in a trendy atmosphere that will last all of 10 more years before it goes under. The food is alright, the drinks are expensive and the service sucks. This place is a place where you take stupid people to make them feel "with-it"

properties.name: CC Slaughters
properties.description: Posted by Realjeremytaste  200 NW 3rd Ave Portland, OR 97209Hilariously bad karaoke redeems this bar for me, if you like dancing you might like this bar on the weekends, but during the week it\'s barely populated and what\'s left is quite sad - yet, they will still hit on you. Drinks are moderately priced, service is usually pretty quick.

properties.name: Casey's
properties.description: Posted by Realjeremytaste  610 NW Couch St, Portland, ORThis gay bar caters to a slightly older crowd, lots of lights and loud dance music to be had along with dudes in jock-straps dancing on the bars. Drinks are kind of pricy.

properties.name: Chin Yen Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Realjeremytaste  18 NE 28th Ave, Portland, ORThe lounge tends to close down early some nights, but it\'s a great place to lounge and drink. The staff is very nice and the drinks are cheap. It\'s got a download jukebox that should cater to any taste, but if no one is playing, the bartender is usually playing picks off an iPod. Go in the entrance with the concert posters and Oregon Lottery sign.

properties.name: Crush
properties.description: Posted by Realjeremytaste   1412 Se Morrison St, Portland, ORCrush is a not-gay gay bar, but I\'m listing it as a gay bar since that seems to be it\'s primary focus considering the staff and the themes of the events they hold. The service can be down right awful depending on the night, but especially in the smokers room. Weekday nights they usually close up early because no one is in there, so don\'t make it a late night unless it is Friday or Saturday.

properties.name: Dixie's
properties.description: Posted by Realjeremytaste 32 NW 3rd Ave, Portland, ORHey ladies! Want to go out and get date-raped by a meathead? Hey guys! Want to see nasty chicks dance on the bars? Then this is the place for you!

properties.name: Dots Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Realjeremytaste  2521 SE Clinton St, PORTLAND, OR, 97202-1238Dots is one of those Portland bars that people ask you if you\'ve been there and then when you say "no" they tell you have to go. Not really sure why, the standards for what makes a bar cool seem to be kind of low in this town. Although, it is dark, the lighting is great and the atmosphere is amazing. On the downside the crowd is a little up-it\'s-own-ass for my taste. Cheap drinks and great service make up for that. It has weird smoking rules in the bar area, the three tables closest to the cafe are non smoking, but in the rest of the area it\'s fine. Not that it will matter come 2009.

properties.name: Doug Fir Lounge
properties.description: Posted by Realjeremytaste    830 E. Burnside Portland, OR 97214This is not a bar to go to alone, you will have a hard time meeting people because just about everyone runs in crowds. It\'s a nice bar though, non-smoking, the beer is a little over-priced, especially downstairs if you are going for a show.

properties.name: Eagle Underground
properties.description: Posted by Realjeremytaste   610 NW Couch St, Portland ORChain bar for leather heads turns into chain bar for hipster gay dudes? Expect snotty guys that won\'t talk to you if you don\'t already know them. The alternative nights can range from packed to just sad, really hit or miss.

properties.name: East End
properties.description: Posted by Realjeremytaste 203 SE Grand Ave, Portland OR, 97214A cool venue for shows, the drinks lean on the side of expensive, but the atmosphere is great, upstairs, downstairs, or in the venue space. If you want service be sure to go for the well and not just any place at the bar, even if you\'ve been sitting there all night you run the risk of getting passed up. Also, as soon as you feel the need to pee, head for the bathroom line, it can be a long wait.

properties.name: Goodfoot Pub (Upstairs)
properties.description: Posted by Realjeremytaste   4 pool tables, 4 pinball machines, countless political paintings on the wall. The drinks are cheap, the service is great, the food is only ok and the music is typical for a hipster hang out bar. Seeting is usually ample, the space is large and open, easy to feel alone, even with a few friends.

properties.name: Holman's Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Realjeremytaste  15 Se 28th Ave, Portland, ORI\'d like to say more about Holman\'s, but they kicked me out because I had one of those paper ID\'s the DMV gives you after you take your drivers test. The beer was going to be cheap, but the bartender was a dick and thought I was trying to fake him out with my state issued ID.

properties.name: La Merde
properties.description: Posted by Realjeremytaste  301 SE Morrison St, Portland ORYou can get some drinking done at Montage, although it is more a restaurant than a bar, head towards the back wall, take a left and go all the way down for the La Merde, and if you want, you can take your drink back over into the dining area and order up some of that Mac & Cheese!

properties.name: Matador
properties.description: Posted by Realjeremytaste  1967 W Burnside St, Portland, OROh the Matador, smoky, slightly run down Matador. This is a great Portland bar, it is laid back, and even when it is getting packed, you can always sit down with strangers and make new friends (unless you\'re weird - and you will soon find out if you are). They usually play good music from the DJ booth, otherwise it\'s jukebox, the drinks are cheap, but it does have one draw back, the staff can be really unpredictable I\'ve encountered some of the nicest people, and a few really shitty ones that stand out.

properties.name: Muu-Muu's Restaurant & Bar
properties.description: Posted by Realjeremytaste  612 NW 21st Ave, Portland, ORModerately priced drinks, great food, and good music, Muu-Muu\'s has all that, but depending on the night the music might be missing, and if the music\'s going - good luck getting a seat. The service is alright, but really, it\'s all about the food here, the food is amazing. A good place to start out the night.

properties.name: Roscoe's
properties.description: Posted by Realjeremytaste   8105 SE Stark StIt\'s a sausage-fest every night at Roscoe\'s, maybe it\'s just the uneven distribution of men and women in Portland, but on any given night you will find a 10 to 1 ratio - a mix of ten men ranging from the old to the hipster to the punk and one woman. Drinks are cheap service is alright, and if you come on Tuesday night have your short-shorts on...

properties.name: Sassy Jack's Pub
properties.description: Posted by Realjeremytaste   417 SE 80th AveThis is easily the brightest bar in all of Portland, there is so much neon in this place it runs the risk of blinding your typical night-owl Alcoho-Frolic. One of my cohorts told me all the neon made everyone look "clean" so maybe it\'s intentional - one thing\'s certain, everyone else getting bathed in "clean" light was the first time most of them had been bathed in anything for quite a while. After ordering drinks from one of the dumbest bartenders I\'ve ever encountered, our group sat down for some Friday night karaoke, soon we were treated to a different kind of entertainment in the form of a large group of mexican men getting into the world\'s slowest moving fight. This resulted in the cops showing up, all before I had a buzz.

properties.name: Scandals Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Realjeremytaste  1125 Sw Stark St, Portland, ORA gay bar that caters to a really old crowd, if you are a younger looking dude with little to no body hair, you will have drinks purchased for you and advances will be made. It\'s laid back otherwise, drinks are moderately priced, the service is OK, the DJ\'s if they are spinning, tend to really suck, sometimes the bartenders play really good music though - really spotty.

properties.name: Slow Bar
properties.description: Posted by Realjeremytaste  533 SE Grand Ave. Portland OR 97214 Upscale hipster bar with tall booths for private conversations, decked out in red - it gives the feel of drinking in a darkroom. Moderate prices and a decent food selection, this bar is good for groups, probably not so much for drinking alone.

properties.name: Speakeasy
properties.description: Posted by Realjeremytaste  If you\'re lacking in tattoos and not dressed mostly in black, stay away, you will feel out of place. The whole place is covered in stickers and graffiti, the tables and chairs seem like they were found on street corners over the years, and the bar tenders range from friendly to downright mean. It\'s cheap and abrasive and I love it.

properties.name: The Egyptian Room
properties.description: Posted by Realjeremytaste    3701 SE Division St, Portland ORThe Egyptian Room, or simply the E-Room is Portland\'s lesbian bar, and walking in with a penis is asking for being ostracized. The food isn\'t good and the bartenders aren\'t skilled in the slightest, but it doesn\'t matter, they could mix the drinks with dirty dildos and people would still flock to the E-Room.

properties.name: The Side Door
properties.description: Posted by Realjeremytaste  425 SE Washington St, Portland ORGood food, cheap beer, and great bartenders, the kind that make you feel like more of a friend than a customer. Tell some jokes!

properties.name: Tube
properties.description: Posted by Realjeremytaste   18 nw 3rd avenue portland oregonTube is one of my favorite bars, moderate price on drinks and a great atmosphere, if you\'re going late, get ready to dance your way through a crowd to get yourself a drink. Get there early and enjoy some great vegan food. Full of hipsters, bathroom lines can get long, and they\'ve always got something playing in the wrong aspect ratio on the TV\'s behind the bar.
